What Makes Millennials Love the Mainframe? Advice from Next-gen Devs - Compuware
What Makes Millennials Love the Mainframe? Advice from Next-gen Devs

I serve as Compuware's President, CEO and a member of the Board of Directors.  Without question, Compuware has a long, uninterrupted record as the leading mainframe solutions provider in test data management, developer productivity and application performance management. That, however, is our history and now we need to earn our future with mainframe customers as the best partner in mainframe solutions for the next 50 years.I'm honored to be part of the best mainframe team in the industry and excited to contribute to its future.Stay tuned to Compuware as we work hard each and every day in all of our customer interactions to raise the value of the mainframe platform.Please visit us at www.compuware.com and follow us on Twitter @Compuware.

Christopher Ventures is designed to help enterprises improve their economic value to the customers, employees and investors served.  We focus on improving the fundamental factors of business success: cash flow, employee engagement, customer satisfaction and continuous improvement.
Bluenog is an IT services and solutions company that provides the resources and expertise for building complex software applications and integrations, with a focus on Oracle technologies.

A need for speed in business decision making is driving requirements for real time analytics gained from all relevant data sources. Velocidata delivers real-time actionable intelligence for operational decision making and the ability to fulfill non-negotiable time-bound SLAs. With high performance, purpose built Big Data operation appliances, we serve customers with high volume and high velocity requirements in the areas of data transformation and data quality.

YJT Solutions is a Chicago-based provider of IT consulting and managed services to companies in a variety of industries that depend on technology.YJT was founded more than a decade ago to help build the IT infrastructure of some of the most demanding and unforgiving companies in the world: Chicago futures and options trading firms. YJT helped these firms transition into the world of electronic trading, and more recently has helped them scale to meet the extremely low latency and big storage demands of high-frequency trading.In recent years YJT has expanded in both scope and reach, bringing that same Chicago toughness to help companies in a variety of industries. YJT will work to help you accelerate profits, lower fixed costs, and reduce operational risk.

Chris graduated with honors from the University of Minnesota with a bachelor’s degree in computer science. He also participated in executive programs at the University of Chicago’s Graduate School of Business and New York University’s Stern School of Business.

The O'Malley Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization established in 1998 that annually grants a college scholarship to a deserving graduating senior from Mound-Westonka High School in Mound, MN; supports various Catholic charities; and supports youth performing arts programs within the greater Chicago area.  These are institutions that have helped nurture the lives of the O'Malley family and for which we, as a family, feel indebted to give back.

Senior Vice President, Worldwide Sales and Business Development at Compuware
December 19, 2014, Pete reported directly to Christopher

I've had the good fortune of working for Chris in a number of different capacities over my career.  Each opportunity has been incredible valuable and rewarding both personally and professionally.  Chris bring an inspiring energy and focus to everything he does, taking organizations and giving them the tools and capability to do more than it ever expected.  His ability to frame a strategy and create momentum within an organization to bring that strategy to life is one of his most impressive traits.  When I reflect on roles that I've had through the course of my career I can say that I've never worked harder, nor felt a greater sense of satisfaction and reward than when I've worked with Chris.  Chris has the innate ability to inspire, challenge, coach and mentor an entire organization while achieving to lofty and audacious goals.

Michael Zinda
SVP Customer Success at Compuware
November 25, 2014, Michael reported directly to Christopher

I have had the pleasure of working with Chris over the past 27 years and have the utmost respect for him as a leader and a mentor.  Chris possess the leadership characteristics that an IT company requires to be successful: passion, humility, integrity and fearlessness.Powerful passion for building a better company and stronger employees builds energy that inspires an entire company. A leader possessing humility recognizes that there is no such thing as a “better” or “worse” team member, and elevates everyone’s contributions. Individuals will only sincerely engage and execute on the goals of a company if they believe their leader has a strong sense of integrity. Fearlessness, thinking differently, taking risks and stepping out of a comfort zone--and inspiring all others to do the same--means all employees feel empowered to take on any challenge to make a company successful. Chris’s leadership, technology insight and operational expertise continually drive a culture of innovation. Through the culture he inspires, I have seen him expand businesses into new markets, extend product portfolios and continually driven sustained growth across every business he has managed.

Chris Mills
Sales Director, Eastern US at Protegrity
November 20, 2014, Chris reported directly to Christopher

Chris, with nearly 30 years of IT experience, is a thinker, a visionary, a pragmatist, an achiever, and a genuine leader of people. Chris’s integrity and honesty are the highest of any individual I have ever met and he is an absolutely transparent manager of his teams. While the CEO of VelociData, Chris repurposed and refocused this young company, achieving success in that most difficult of market segments, the US fortune 100. Every aspect of VelociData’s infrastructure has been built and rebuilt by Chris to achieve customer success and sustainable revenue. VelociData’s engineering team, customer support functions, Sales and Operations Management have all benefited from relentless rigor and attention to the smallest details, which are the hallmarks of Chris’s focus. Measurable achievements include doubling the number of customers, including one of the world’s largest and most prestigious financial services market leaders. Revenue increases matched growth in the customer base while containing cost in ways that are unique to Chris and his commitment to his business and his customers. It was my absolute pleasure to share time with Chris at VelociData.

Chris Mills
Sales Director, Eastern US at Protegrity
February 26, 2015, Christopher managed Chris directly

I’ve had the pleasure of working with Chris at multiple companies and in multiple roles.  Chris has mastered a very unique combination of leadership skills, sales acumen, emotional intelligence and inquisitive nature that have earned him consistent success in a wide variety of roles, markets, business models and countries.  Chris led a successful turnaround effort at CA Technologies that rebuilt our brand and improved our performance in the Illinois market.  He was one of Informatica’s highest performing sales managers after having built an experienced team to serve some of the largest financial services companies in the US.  Chris has demonstrated his entrepreneurial skills in two successful startups with the most recent being VelociData.  At VelociData, Chris leads worldwide sales and has been the critical success factor in moving the company from its very earliest stages to a Fortune 100 customer base.Integral to Chris’ professional success are the strengths in his character.  His commitment, will, integrity, inspiration, loyalty and steadfast friendship are above reproach.

summary: Chris O’Malley is Compuware's President and CEO, as well as, serves on the Compuware Board of Directors.Chris has been interviewed on national radio for his thought leadership within IT and a featured contributor of articles and columns to technology, business and government focused publications. Chris was honored as one of the top 50 names to know in IT by Crain's Detroit Business in 2017[27] and selected by Sigma Chi Fraternity as Significant Sigma Chi in 2017.Chris has more than 25 years of leadership experience in the IT industry & held a variety of executive positions —including President and CEO of Compuware, CEO of VelociData, CEO of Nimsoft, EVP/GM CA Technologies'  Cloud Products & Solutions Business Unit & IT Management SaaS solutions and EVP/GM of CA Technologies' Mainframe Business Unit. Chris graduated with honors from the University of Minnesota with a BS in Computer Science. He also participated in executive programs at the University of Chicago’s Graduate School of Business & the New York University’s Stern School of Business.Chris is the founder & board member of the O'Malley Foundation, a charitable organization that grants college scholarships to deserving students, as well as, supports various youth arts programs & Catholic charities.
name: Christopher O'Malley
title: President and CEO at Compuware
